channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report I-2025030043
item.description:
Report I-2025030043

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-15
  • City: Hartford
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PILOT TRAVEL CENTERS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 256000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver of vehicle owned by Pilot Travel Centers crossed an uncontrolled rail-grade crossing without performing the necessary steps to ensure the crossing was clear. As a result, a train made contact with the trailer, resulting in a release of 1400 gallons of diesel fuel from the trailer. Additionally, a fuel tank on the train engine was ruptured, resulting in a release of 600 gallons of dyed diesel.

item.title: Report E-2025030298
item.description:
Report E-2025030298

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-24
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Overfill company tank at terminal resulting in a spill contained by the dike with ULSD seeping into the gravel lot. Cleanup vendor assessed and confirmed that the containment unit for the UST had been overfilled, and had roughly 3-4 inches of standing diesel in the bottom of the containment unit. Estimated release of 200-300 gallons with the large majority of product confined to the containment unit. Approximately 23 gallons splashed out and reached the ground. CDG managed this spill cleanup and notified NCDEQ.

item.title: Report E-2025020412
item.description:
Report E-2025020412

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-26
  • City: LOXLEY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, they observed an estimated (150) gallons of material released from one (1) 330-gallon plastic tote punctured by a forklift. Clean Harbors personnel observed that the released material impacted 30 ft-by-30 ft area of dock floor concrete. Clean Harbors personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized them into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining material in the product tote was to be transferred to a new 330-gallon IBC tote. However, both pumps cleaned harbors brought were faulty. They had obtained a functional pump from a local supplier and began pumping out the material. Work was paused to obtain upgraded PPE. After obtaining the correct PPE, personnel were able to complete the tote transfer. The incident generated a total of six (6) containers. One (1) 55-gallon poly drum contains two (2) 330-gallon poly tote bladders (cut up), Poly sheeting, and PPE. One (1) 55-gallon poly drum contains a diaphragm pump rinse water. One (1) 330-gallon tote contains the original product. Three (3) 55-gallon poly drums contain absorbent debris. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025030035
item.description:
Report E-2025030035

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-24
  • City: WAYCROSS
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 75000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 2-24-25 at 0408 personnel in the CSXT Rice Yard discovered SHPX 455351, a loaded hopper car of Ammonium Nitrate had collided with SHLX 359 a loaded tank car of Molten Sulfur. The result was the first hopper compartment of SHPX 455351 had failed and released product. Marion Environmental, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene to remove spilled lading.

item.title: Report E-2025030248
item.description:
Report E-2025030248

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: TYRONE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: M. C. TANK TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 46000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: This is a customer unload. After arriving at the plant, the driver sits in his Tractor while the customer unloads the trailer. After the customer hooked up, they began to offload with a 3'' pump. Approximately 1 hour into the unloading cycle, the trailer suffered a vaccum collapse. It was determined that the customer failed to ensure that a ball valve was open on their vapor recovery line. Approximately 2000 gallons of HCL spilled from the bottom of the trailer During the event. All but 100-200 gallons was caught in their containment area. The remaining material left containment and leaked onto a gravel area leading to the unloading area. 1800 gallons inside containment was pumped into totes, and the material that left containment in a gravel area was neutralized and then disposed of by plant personnel. The trailer will be totaled by our insurance company.

item.title: Report E-2025030256
item.description:
Report E-2025030256

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: DENISON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 89350
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On February 19, 2025, at 1938 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Denison, Texas regarding the release of Sulfuric Acid 50%. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 775 gallons of Sulfuric Acid 50% (UN2796, 8, II) from (3) 330-gallon plastic totes onto asphalt and an adjacent ditch. The release was reportedly due to a rollover accident, impacting multiple areas of asphalt and soil. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was neutralized then cleaned with absorbents and the proper PPE. Removal of impacted soil is pending future remediation by contractors. All waste generated from the emergency response portion of addressing this release was containerized in (6) 55-gallon DFs which were taken onsite by contractors pending proper disposal.
